entry.name: Destruction Holding List
entry.value: The virtual list of all items stored in the Destruction Holding Area.

entry.name: DHCP
entry.value: Decentralized Hospital Computer Program (often referred to in the document as VistA)

entry.name: DHHS
entry.value: Department of Health and Human Services

entry.name: DICOM
entry.value: Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

entry.name: DIF
entry.value: Drug Information Framework

entry.name: Digital Signature
entry.value: Part of a Veterans Administration (VA)/Drug enforcement Agency (DEA) Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) Pilot project to introduce electronic signature for Outpatient medication orders of Schedule 2 and Schedule 2n controlled substances. DEA policy is that these CS cannot be signed for electronically and require a “wet” signature or hand-written prescription that goes to the pharmacy. This pilot project uses smart cards, card readers attached to workstations, digital certificates, and other technologies to electronically (digitally) sign Outpatient orders for Schedule 2 and Schedule 2n CS.

entry.name: Dispense Class
entry.value: A classification of drugs/items. The Dispense Classes are Controlled Substances, non-Controlled Substances, Investigational/Research, and Supply. For each drug there will be an associated Y/N parameter for Refrigeration.

entry.name: Dispense Quantity Limit
entry.value: A VA Data Field that specifies the limit as a Quantity-per-Time period. Quantity is the number of dispense units. Time period is specified by a number of days.

entry.name: Dispense Request
entry.value: A single dispensing action for an order (e.g., an order may contain an original Dispense Request and 11 refills. In this case, the order has a total of 12 Dispense Requests.) A dispense request can have the following statuses: “Pending,” “Filled,” “Checked,” “Delivered,” “Cancelled,” “Exception.” In addition, for Inpatient only, a dispense request can have a status of “In Transit.”

entry.name: Dispense Unit
entry.value: A unit of measure for dispensing (e.g., GM, EA).

entry.name: Dispense Unit Domain
entry.value: Provides the list of available dispense units for a Product Item.

entry.name: Dispensed Inventory
entry.value: The inventory that has been used to fill an activated Inpatient or Outpatient order. It is used as the point in the process where quantities used are debited from pharmacy supply locations. See related glossary term Replenishment.

entry.name: DO
entry.value: Data Object

entry.name: Do Not Mail
entry.value: A VA Data Field used to indicate that an item cannot be mailed by the local pharmacy.

entry.name: DoD
entry.value: Department of Defense

entry.name: Domain
entry.value: Refers to data elements used by PEPS items; for example: Manufacturer, Standard Med Route. Usually domain in this context refers to a domain entry, not necessarily the entire domain.

entry.name: Dosage Form
entry.value: The medium used to administer the active ingredient(s) in health products. Dosage forms include, but are not limited to capsules, tablets, injectables, oral solutions, drops, creams, ointments, and patches.

entry.name: Dosage Form Domain
entry.value: Contains the list of available dosage forms that can be used for an Orderable Item.

entry.name: Dose
entry.value: A specified quantity of a therapeutic agent, such as a drug, prescribed to be taken at one time or at stated intervals.

entry.name: DPP
entry.value: Detailed Project Plan

entry.name: Draft Order
entry.value: A dispense order entered into the system by a user, but not completed or not submitted to pharmacy for dispensing.

entry.name: Drug Class
entry.value: The grouping of drug products based on various criteria, which may include similarity of chemical structure, clinical indications, pharmacology, and therapeutic activity.

entry.name: Drug Class Domain
entry.value: Contains the list of VA Drug Classifications that can be used for Product Items.

entry.name: Drug Data Vendor
entry.value: The company that supplies medical information products (e.g., MicroMedex or First DataBank).

entry.name: Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) Number
entry.value: A numbering system that was implemented as a way to successfully track CS from the time they are manufactured until the time they are dispensed to the Patient or destroyed according to DEA regulations.

entry.name: Drug Indication Dosing
entry.value: Allows for different dosages for different disease states as well as for different Patient conditions. For example, the dose for Megestrol used for anorexia is 800mg daily, whereas the dose for Megestrol used for breast cancer is 40mg four times daily. Additionally, doses for Patients with impaired renal or hepatic clearances may have to be adjusted.

entry.name: Drug Unit Domain
entry.value: Provides the list of available units of measure that can be used for a medication.

entry.name: Drug/Disease Interaction
entry.value: An event that occurs when a drug’s action or effect are altered by a disease or clinical condition. May result in worsening of the disease by the drug.

entry.name: Drug/Drug Interaction
entry.value: The pharmacological or clinical response to the administration of a drug combination different from that anticipated from the known effects of the two agents when given alone.

entry.name: DSD
entry.value: Delivery Service Delegate

entry.name: DSS
entry.value: Decision Support System

entry.name: DTAC
entry.value: Development Technology Advisory Committee

entry.name: Duration
entry.value: The amount of time that the Patient should use the specified dose. This can be calculated from the time between the Start Date/Time and Stop Date/Time for an Inpatient medication order.

entry.name: DUZ
entry.value: A value that identifies a specific end-user signed into the VistA system. The DUZ is being replaced by the VPID but is still in use.

entry.name: DVA
entry.value: Department of Veterans Affairs

entry.name: E3R
entry.value: Electronic, Error, and Enhancement Report

entry.name: EBAC
entry.value: Entity-Based Access Control

entry.name: ebXML
entry.value: Electronic Business eXtensible Markup Language

entry.name: ECMB
entry.value: Executive Change Management Board

entry.name: ECME
entry.value: Electronic Claims Management Engine

entry.name: ECR
entry.value: Engineering Change Request

entry.name: ECSS
entry.value: Electronic Claims Submission System

entry.name: EDI
entry.value: Electronic Data Interchange

entry.name: EDS
entry.value: Electronic Data Systems

entry.name: EE
entry.value: External Environment

entry.name: eInvoice
entry.value: An invoice received electronically into the pharmacy system from the prime vendor for medications.

entry.name: EJB
entry.value: Enterprise Java Bean

entry.name: Electrolyte
entry.value: An additive that disassociates into ions (charged particles) when placed in solution.

entry.name: Electronic Error and Enhancement Request (E3R)
entry.value: A software application located on Forum. It is used VHA-wide to submit suggestions for changes to Office of Information Field Office (OIFO) software products.

entry.name: Electronic Pharmacy Claims/Billing
entry.value: Electronic billing for outpatient prescriptions at point of care service.

entry.name: Electronic Signature
entry.value: A computer data compilation of any symbol or series of symbols executed, adopted, and/or authorized by an individual to be the legally binding equivalent of the individual’s handwritten signature. See glossary term Digital Signature for expansion of this concept within the VA.

entry.name: Element
entry.value: An object that encompasses a set of versions, organized into a version tree. They can be either files or directories.

entry.name: Email Group
entry.value: A group of individuals who receive email and alerts about a topic pertaining to the group.

entry.name: Emergency Cache
entry.value: A bulk supply of drugs stored in central pharmacy specifically for use in large scale emergencies or catastrophic events. The supply is not available for use in filling Patient orders unless released to the pharmacy prior to replacement or expiration.

entry.name: Encapsulation
entry.value: The hiding of a software object’s internal representation. The object provides an interface that queries and manipulates the data without exposing its underlying structure.

entry.name: Encounter
entry.value: A professional contact between a Patient and a Practitioner. A Patient may have multiple encounters for one appointment or during a single visit to a Department of Veterans Affairs Medical Center (VAMC) facility.

entry.name: Enhancement Requests
entry.value: A type of stakeholder request that specifies a new feature or functionality of the system.

entry.name: Enterprise Architecture
entry.value: The architecture that incorporates an entire business or major portion thereof.

entry.name: Enterprise Product List (EPL)
entry.value: A compendium of medications, supplies, and prosthetics available for ordering.

entry.name: Enterprise Reference Terminology (ERT)
entry.value: A standardized set of medical vocabulary used within VHA systems, provides for the sets that accommodate local variations in terminology, and supports automated translation among terminology sets.

entry.name: Enterprise Terminology Service (ETS)
entry.value: The inclusive name for both the ERT and VETS projects. ETS determines terminology for clinical content (i.e., Pharmacy, Labs, Orders, Vitals). ETS has been renamed to Standardized Terminology Service (STS) .

entry.name: Entity Bean
entry.value: A reusable software component used to implement business logic; multiple clients can access it simultaneously; it represents persistent items that could be stored in a database.

entry.name: Entry By
entry.value: The name of the user who entered the order into the computer.

entry.name: ePharmacy
entry.value: VA electronic pharmacy claims. Used to transmit claims between the VHA and insurance providers.

entry.name: EPL
entry.value: Enterprise Product List

entry.name: EPL-L
entry.value: EPL Local

entry.name: EPL-M
entry.value: EPL Master

entry.name: EPL-N
entry.value: EPL National

entry.name: ER
entry.value: Emergency Room
